thread.title: South Carolina: Heavy rain, windy Friday into Saturday
thread.title_full: South Carolina: Heavy rain, windy Friday into Saturday

author: Parella Lewis
title: South Carolina: Heavy rain, windy Friday into Saturday
text: Heavy rain with cooler temperatures Friday into Saturday WYFF News 4 has issued Live Super Doppler 4 Impact Days as heavy rain will arrive Friday afternoon and continue through Saturday morning. The heaviest rain will be Friday night and overnight into early Saturday morning. A couple of showers are possible Saturday afternoon, but the bulk of the rain should end sooner for most of the Upstate. Highs on Saturday will be in the mid-60s. It will be breezy to windy Friday with gusts up to 25 mph, becoming much more blustery Saturday night. Gusts up to 35 mph with cold temperatures return Saturday night into Sunday morning. It will be freezing in the mountains on Saturday night with patchy frost in the Upstate. Watch your full forecast in the video above. - Track rain and storms on the interactive radar [here](https://www.wyff4.com/weather/radar) - Check the latest alerts in your area [here](https://www.wyff4.com/alerts) - Watch live skycams from around the Carolinas [here](https://www.wyff4.com/article/skycams/7024478) - Get your hour-by-hour and extended forecast [here](https://www.wyff4.com/weather) Palm Sunday is expected to be sunny and nice, with high temperatures in the upper 60s. Increasing clouds move in Monday ahead of possible showers on Tuesday and Wednesday of next week.
